Review Text: Mawella Beach, near Tangalle in southern Sri Lanka, is a calm and scenic stretch of coastline known for its golden sand and gentle waves. Lined with palm trees and small fishing boats, it offers a peaceful atmosphere away from crowds. The shallow waters are ideal for swimming, while the surrounding village life gives visitors an authentic coastal experience.

Review Title: There are nicer beaches just nearby
Review Text: In reality, the beach is not so beautiful and quite narrow at high tide, no people there, no hotel, secluded spot for those who want a beach to themselves...

Lovely sandy beach which, given it was the middle of September when we were there, we more or less had to ourselves.  The beach is nice fine sand but the sea is toorough for swimming. Great for bodybuilding. Due to the season there were not many restaurants open, Some nice bays/beaches within walking  or tuk tuk distance

Review Title: Peaceful, clean beach - in our case, perfectly place for family holidays
Review Text: We have spent here 3 days not even wanting to leave the place (maybe after intensive sightseeing before). The kids and us had great time swimming in the crystal clear ocean, jumping in the waves and observing crabs in the evenings.

Review Title: Beautiful yet calm and quiet beach
Review Text: An ideal spot for a relaxing trip. Body boarding and surfing is possible around the bay area. Only a couple of hotels and restaurants are available. Ideal for tourists who would want a quiet and peaceful environment to relax. The local fishing community is also located in the bay if you would wish to speak to them and gain experience.

My family and I (3 adults, 4 children ages 7, 6, 3, &1) stayed at a private villa located directly on the west side of this beach.  This is a long beach that is pretty much only used by local fishermen.  Not built up at all and we maybe saw two other tourist couples during our 5 day stay.  The beach is clean and a sand bottom.  The waves were great for our kids and all three older ones played in them.  We were able to surf and ride some waves as well.  This beach is a prime example of the beauty of the far south of Sri Lanka as it is very local (in a good way) and unspoiled.  For reference, we visited in March and sea condition was very good for swimming.  Great place for a sunrise.
By far the best beach I have ever seen, beautiful soft sand, clear blue sea, but a bit to rough to swim in but ok to paddle, very quiet but sunsets to die for.

Review Title: Cosy, quiet place directly by the ocean
Review Text: Great place to be. Reasonably priced, with a few cosy bungalows, a pool and some sunbeds at guests' disposal. Very friendly and helpful staff, that can arrange anything you need. And what's most important, kilometres of calm, quiet, almost empty, wide and clean beach. A couple of small local restaurants (including one in the resort) are there for a nice Sri-Lankan lunch and dinner - there is always something to choose from.

This is a quiet beach that has great swimming. Maxwell has a lovely pool and you can watch the waves from your balcony. It is a little tired but the price reflects that. Next door is a slick but soulless posh hotel that does have the character of the little Santa houses

Review Title: Sea Grageen Restaurant - The hidden gem at Mawella beach
Review Text: Freshly caught seafood cooked with Love and served with a Smile :) Shahani and Sanjeevani the 2 sisters do an awesome job of keeping the restaurant Alive :) 200% recommended...Can't wait to go back there myself 👌
Did some boogie boarding with the kids and helped some fishermen push their boats out. Very nice. No food options here though.

made a surprise visit to Mawella and was pleasantly surprised. elegantly designed rooms overlooking a beutifully landscaped garden, so it offers space as much as it has an almost private beach on the south coast. rooms are designed beautifull by "Taru" the owner who has a passion for creating novel interiors. staff and service is good.

This beach left in me deep impression. It is so beatiful, so untouched and there are almost no people. All around Tangalle are pretty high waves, but here you can find also safe part, where the waves are not that gangerous. If you are in Tangalle, you must go here!

Fantastic get-away-from-it all beach.  Very limited sunbeds.. by beach shacks or dragged onto beach from accommodation.. Advertised as safe swimming, but be careful as undertow strong on occasions  and our hotel had a guide as to 'what to do in a riptide!'. A few small hotels have gardens right onto the beach. A couple of good beach shacks selling excellent fish (you can place your order earlier in day and discuss how you want fish cooked... so we got more fish in our curry than traditional Sri Lankan dishes). Take a torch for evening meal. Some of the hotels did not welcome' outside guests' in for meals or refreshments. Slight issue with dogs, but they bark at everyone  (not as suggested by jogger below!) and their fighting amongst themselves was a bit ferocious at times. Other than that, just a few  birds, monkeys, fishermen and the occasional stray tourist to keep you company.
This is basically a local beach.Not many people. A  beach for people who like privacy.No beach facilities.

Not many people on the beach, some nice fisherman's boat but no facility for a beach bed or anything like that. Please note that there is a small seafood "restaurant " a little cabana owned by fisherman's and their family. Maybe the best fish we ever had ! Don't miss it !! It's the fresh fish we saw them bringing back on their boats . just delicious !

A beautiful 2 kilometre stretch of beach. This is a very beautiful beach. We stayed at villa Mawella for 9 nights and strolled along the beach 3 times a day. the local fishing boats are dotted along the shore, the sand is nice and firm to walk along, the Indian ocean is ridiculously beautiful and warm. You may see 10 people in total as you walk along the beach and half of those will be locals fixing their nets and tending to their boats. Magical place and after 9 days if we were any more relaxed we would be dead!

We stayed in a private house along Mawella Beach last week.  It is small, private and not touristy at all. I  attempted a morning jog along the beach however a small group of dogs, which I  never saw again, seemed upset at a white person running and they were persistent. Each day the fisherman wanted a hand bringing their boats in and you are rewarded with a few of their catches which was lovely. On our last night we gave our cook the night off and they recommended we go to Mawella Beach Resort for dinner,  this was a huge mistake,  no one was staying at the restaurant and we were the only people eating there so the options were chicken or fish for dinner. The meals took 1 & 1/2 hours to arrive and one of the pieces of chicken was raw (we were not charged for this). The  large mixed salad was simply an oval plate piled with sliced cucumber, a few slices of tomato,  a handful of grated carrot and cabbage in the middle, and it was more than twice the price of the main meals. We were very disappointed in our meals there. Mawella Beach is wonderful but I wouldn't recommend eating at Mawella Beach Resort restaurant.

We arrived middle in the day and as soon we saw the place decided to stay for 3 nights. The owner of the place very helpful and the staff were friendly. They got small pool and beach is out of season to swim but we had great fun with playing in waves. Cannot say food is excellent but when I compare with street restaurant it was really good. Food potions are very big. It was happy time
Loved it. Sea fun but strong waves, nice to play in. Bit of an undercurrent. Just a few people, fishermen, cows. Total relaxation. Watch out for sandflies in the afternoon
This beach seems to have flown below the radar - at least a kilometer long but no one there except for the fishermen and occasional cow. Firm sand underfoot, no steep drop off and great body surfing.

This is, undoubtedly, one of the most beautiful beaches in the area. Not any tourists still, so you can relax in peace and quiet and enjoy the sea, the sand and the atmosphere.  We stayed in the Mawella beach resort for 1 night whilst waiting to go to our chosen guest house due to arriving earlier than planned and were initially pleased with price, location and the little garden chalets.  This all changed with the absolutely frightful staff!!  One young waiter was lovely...the three other men around the restaurand and lobby area were another matter completely. One was patrolling the garden with a big stick, looking for dogs...he seemed amazed that we were angry at his  behaviour towards animals (thought Buddhists were opposed to cruelty???), the other two seemed eager to get rid of us ASAP, turned the lights off and hovered around looking at their watches...at 10pm and whilst we were having our after dinner drinks.  We will NOT be going back!!
It is a bit outside Tangalle but definitely worth the cycle or tuk tuk ride. This was my favourite beach in Tangalle.

lovely beach within a village community so lots of working fish boats adding a sense of authenticity however the beach is quite off the main road and you need transport ( buses  are frequent  to get to either tangalle town or dickwella if you want to potter about which I like doing
